What about the counter view that each client and server combo is
the 'application'

Sent from my Windows Phone
From: Erik Wilde
Sent: 3/7/2012 2:23 PM
To: mike amundsen
Cc: Glenn Block; rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Does the client contribute to the
RESTfulness of an application?
hello.

On Mar 7, 2012, at 11:27, mike amundsen <mamund@...> wrote:
> if someone implements a client app that hardcodes URIs and workflow and ignores the affordance details I supply from the service, that does not "diminish" the "REST-itude" of my efforts.

well said. as illustration, imagine the many ways in which browsers
can be broken and sometimes are. such as not making @src links on
q/blockquote elements navigable. or firefox' recent decision to not
display anymore that a page has associated feeds. all cases where no
matter how you publish your data, poorly implemented clients can
diminish its usefulness.

cheers,

dret.
